content.description:
A wonderfully lengthy and varied sport route on the left side of the Bishop formation. 

  Overcome a few surprisingly perplexing bolts on green lichen covered stone.  Carefully continue upward past moderate, slightly unsettling, fractured features (I dislodged a few fit-sized pieces with a brush of the hand).  Ascend a left leaning dihedral clipping the fixed chain draw.  Battle the final steep headwall, using a broken crack, to the chains.
content.protection: Approximately 12 bolts to a leaver biner anchor.  There is a fixed chain to assist in the cleaning process since the route trends left.
content.location: This is the leftmost route on the Bishop formation.  The first few bolts ascend angular green lichen covered rock in contrast to the three routes to the right which start on vertical tan rock.  To the right of this route is Flogging The Bishop.  There is no route to the left in this sector.

content.description: Contains BETA * Hard and sequential for the first 3 bolts. Have an attentive belayer as it's not hard to slip off the slanty footholds here. Above there are some pumpy sections but probably 11a/b at most. The no-hands rest in the middle doesn't really change the fact that there are 11+ moves at the bottom.
Pitch one, 5.9 trad, pitch two, 160 feet of 5.10 sport with 3 good bulges along the way.
content.location: right side of super secret area

content.description: Middle route of three sport routes on Bishop formation
Technical climbing leads to an overlap and an exciting run to the anchors.

climbs.name: Cornickopia
climbs.fa: Doug Cornick, EFR, Jim Scott, Erica Bigio - 2008

content.description:
Fun climbing, moves around a bit to stay in the grade. 

  Good warmup for harder climbs to the left.
content.location: First sport climb to the right of Nuts and Bolts.

climbs.name: Castle
climbs.fa: EFR, Jimbo, Erica B, Scott C

content.description: L of nuts and bolts, this line shares anchors w/ p1 of n&b. Many places you'd bounce a bit if you fell.  Great warm up alternative if bored with the checkerboard moderates.
content.location: First bolted line L of of the left angling ramp that is nuts and bolts, right of the left angling seam of sacramental whining.

content.description:
One gear, one mixed, and five sport routes comprise the Bishop sector.  Grades range from 5.10- to 5.12-. Heelium and Flogging the Bishop are popular 5.12- lines.  Nuts and Bolts is two pitches, the first of which is mixed. 

  This wall is shaded until approximately 2pm.
